sen.e: The Simotsuki Incident was a political change in the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) that occurred in Kamakura in the latter half of the Kamakura period on December 21, 1285.

sen.e: This was an incident that occurred after the eighth regent Tokimune HOJO died and the senior vassal, Yasumori ADACHI, Uchi-Kanrei (head of Tokuso Family) and TAIRA no Yoritsune were in opposition to each other and then Yasumori, his family and the ruling party were destroyed by the Yoritsuna party's pre-emptive attacks.

sen.e: Yasumori ADACHI was a member of the Adachi clan, senior vassals since the Kamakura government was established and supported the regent Tokimune HOJO as a maternal relative of the Tokuso Family of the Hojo clan, and were key figures experienced in important positions like a Osso (legal institutions of Kamakura bakufu, which filled the role of hearing cases such as retrials and direct appeals to a senior official) and Goon bugyo (御恩奉行) (commissioner of the grant of honors/distribution of rewards).

sen.j: 本来鎌倉殿と御家人の主従関係で成り立っていた幕府内部において、総領制が行き詰まった。

sen.e: The Hojo clan couldn't get over Shogun issue in the end as Tokuso couldn't become Shogun due to his low status by birth eventhough he was the most powerful lord of the Kamakura bakufu.
